title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco, 26, and Brandon Baez, 23, sentenced for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison; Baez 24 months, with restitution ordered for both.
From June 2023 to February 2024, they stole checks from USPS boxes, altered and redeposited them.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE last year, invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was detained in May 2025 in a 'collateral arrest' targeting his father; he had no criminal record.
Detention conditions were described as 'humiliating'; community protests followed, demanding his release.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a regrettable center-ice goal in Team USA's Olympic game against Denmark.
Swayman humorously addressed the goal by noting his colorblindness in response to theories about visibility issues.
Team USA defeated Denmark despite Swayman's performance, with speculation he may not start again in the Olympics.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum may soon return from an Achilles injury, impacting the Boston Celtics' season outlook.
Kevin Durant, with similar injury experience, expects Tatum to return to All-Star form in his recovery.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's comeback could strengthen the Celtics' playoff chances without hindering team dynamics.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million cap space to target free agents in key positions this offseason.
Ideal free agents include Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker to strengthen offense.
Bills C Connor McGovern and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips among players pegged for potential Patriots moves.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV announced a new streaming partnership, making ESPN the primary streaming home for MLB games.
Subscribers to ESPN Unlimited can add MLB.TV for $134.99, while non-subscribers can purchase it for $149.99 with a free month trial.
Participants must register for MLB.TV via the ESPN app, but an ESPN Unlimited subscription is not required after the first month.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a recent practice with the Celtics' G League affiliate, the Maine Celtics, amid Achilles rehab.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. noted Tatum looked like himself during practice, raising hopes for Tatum's potential season return.
Despite practicing, Tatum's status on the injury report remains unchanged with no set timetable for his return.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in the latest WalletHub study.
The study highlighted Massachusetts for its high levels of higher education attainment and public school performance.
Vermont and Maryland were ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card with Massachusetts connections is up for auction, closing February 21.
The card was kept by Morton Bernstein's family, who owned a silver plant in Taunton, Massachusetts, for 116 years.
The card has become part of a Netflix show and could sell for over $6 million, with a current bid of $4.76 million.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman to start in net for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman has a 22-12-3 record, 2.92 GAA, and .903 save percentage this season with the Boston Bruins.
Swayman helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, boosting his Olympic team selection.
